title: Hala Gorani says goodbye to viewers
description: CNN's Hala Gorani signs off of "Hala Gorani Tonight" for the last time as she takes a break from daily news.

title: Hear CEO admit Boeing 'probably shouldn't have' made Air Force One deal with Trump
description: In an earnings call, Boeing CEO David Calhoun said the company "probably shouldn't have taken" a deal in 2018 negotiated by then-President Trump to build new Air Force One.

title: Recession fears are mounting
description: Warnings of a potential recession aren't surprising given how many tripwires there are in today's economy.

title: Kim Kardashian cries as Kanye West retrieves rest of sex tape
description: We now have more insight into how Kanye West helped Kim Kardashian get the remaining footage of her infamous sex tape.

title: Biden asks Congress for $33 billion in aid to Ukraine as war enters new phase
description: President Joe Biden on Thursday asked Congress for a $33 billion supplemental funding bill aimed at supporting Ukraine over the next several months as Russia's brutal and unrelenting war enters a new phase.

title: A disastrous day for Democrats' 2022 chances
Donald Trump lived in fear of being hit by, um, 'dangerous' fruit
description: Donald Trump feared being killed by thrown fruit.

title: So, Joe Manchin was kidding about switching parties?
description: In their book, "This Will Not Pass," New York Times reporters Jonathan Martin and Alex Burns write of a dinner between Republican Sens. John Thune, Susan Collins and Rob Portman and Democratic Sen. Joe Manchin in early 2021.

title: US and over 55 other countries commit to democratic internet governance
description: More than 55 countries and the United States announced their commitment Thursday to defending a free and open internet, agreeing to uphold digital human rights in response to rising authoritarianism in cyberspace.

title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's court battle turns spotlight back on their careers
description: Actors Johnny Depp and Amber Heard, best known, perhaps, for their performances as a swashbuckler and a sea warrior, respectively, currently find themselves starring in a contentious defamation trial in Virginia.

title: China's Weibo shows user locations to combat 'bad behavior'
description: Weibo, China's equivalent of Twitter, told users on Thursday it would start to publish their IP locations on their account pages and when they post comments, in a bid to combat "bad behavior" online.

title: Russian gas customers in Europe may accept Putin's payment terms
Russian spacewalkers will 'flex' space station's robotic arm
description: Two Russian cosmonauts will give the International Space Station's new robotic arm a bit of a workout on Thursday.

title: 'Avatar 2' debuts footage from movie at CinemaCon and gets official title
description: "Avatar 2" is finally closer to reality.

title: He was tortured by Russians for eight days and left in the forest to die
description: Oleg Moskalenko is a Ukrainian man who was captured and tortured by Russian troops for several days and left for dead in the forest. He shares his harrowing story of survival on CNN's New Day.

title: Following Elon Musk's takeover, Twitter's leadership is likely in for a shakeup
description: Assuming all goes to plan, Elon Musk won't actually own Twitter for another few months but his swift deal for the company left watchers wondering what his takeover will mean for its management team. Will CEO Parag Agrawal, who's only held that position for four months, stick around? Will Musk, who already helms multiple companies, try to run the platform himself? Could cofounder Jack Dorsey, who just left to focus on running payments company Block, return to an executive role?

title: McDonald's left with millions of dollars of Russian food it can't use
description: McDonald's exit from Russia is costing it a lot of money — and food.

title: Soaring costs and shortages push German industry to the brink
description: Siempelkamp Giesserei has seen its fair share of crises in its 99 years. But pandemic shutdowns, supply chain disruptions and soaring energy prices have thrown the Düsseldorf metals factory into uncharted territory.

title: A Russian soldier asked how she lost her eye. Here is the awful truth
description: On March 15, Halyna Moroskhovskaya was cooking soup for 172 people in the city-run dormitory she managed in Mariupol. Like her, the residents were sheltering in temporary accommodation while Russian forces relentlessly shelled her home city.

title: See the tiny robot that's spying on penguins in Antarctica
description: Scientists are using robots to study the vulnerability of marine ecosystems and the impact of climate change on Antarctica. Watch how this tiny robot has been accepted into an Emperor penguin colony.

title: UN official speaks out after meeting with Putin
description: UN Secretary General António Guterres speaks to Anderson Cooper about his meeting with Vladimir Putin and how he is trying to open humanitarian corridors in Ukraine.

title: One ticket wins the $473.1 million Powerball jackpot
description: The year's second-largest Powerball jackpot is off the board, with only one winning ticket to claim it.

title: Meta earnings and the metric Wall Street is obsessing over
description: Every quarter, investors on Wall Street parse earnings for intel on how much money a company brings in and the size of its profit.

title: Russian gas customers in Europe may accept Putin's terms
description: Some of Russia's biggest natural gas customers in Europe's are preparing to accept the Kremlin's new payment terms rather than risk being cut off by Moscow, a fate suffered by Poland and Bulgaria this week.

title: In Russian-occupied Kherson, allegations of rape emerge
How the widening war in Ukraine will cost the world
description: The vicious epicenter of the war in Ukraine now rests in the scorched cities of the east and the south. But the conflict's reverberations are widening in a way that will leave few people on Earth -- from small-town America to poverty-stricken Africa -- untouched.

title: The delicious snack you can only find in Venice
description: "Cicchetti is the glue that holds Venice together," says mask maker Sergio Boldrin of Bottega dei Mascareri. "It is impossible to think of finishing work without stopping for a drink and a snack on the way home, meeting friends, catching up on the news of the day."

title: 'Fish lizard' fossils found in Swiss Alps belonged to some of the largest creatures that ever lived
description: The fossils of giant, extinct marine reptiles have been found in an unlikely place: within the high altitudes of the Swiss Alps.

title: Military analyst explains Russian tank 'jack-in-the-box' flaw
description: Experts say there is a design flaw in some Russian tanks that the Ukrainians have been able to exploit. Military analyst Maj. Gen. Paul Eaton explains the "jack-in-the-box" effect.

title: Strategist criticizes Marjorie Taylor Greene's remark about Catholic church
description: In an interview with "Right Wing Watch," Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) criticized the Catholic Church's support of migrants, saying "Satan is controlling the church."

title: American Trevor Reed is back in the US after being released from Russia in prisoner swap, his mother says
description: American Trevor Reed, a US citizen and former Marine who had been detained in Russia since 2019, is back in the United States, his mother Paula Reed tweeted early Thursday.

title: Met Gala 2022: Everything you need to know about the 'Gilded Glamour' theme
description: When celebrities take to the Met Gala red carpet on May 2, there will likely be no shortage of corset boning and bustles.

title: 'Queer Eye' star Tan France opens up about bleaching his skin when he was 9
description: "Queer Eye" star Tan France has opened up about bleaching his skin when he was 9 years old, saying that he wanted to appear "as non-Asian as possible."

title: People in Beijing can now book a taxi with no one at the wheel
description: For the first time in China, people will be able to get a taxi ride without anyone behind the wheel.

title: Jarrod Bowen: 'The dream is a reality now,' says West Ham star
description: Jarrod Bowen joined West Ham United in January 2020 and as he looks back over the last few years with the club it's almost as if he can't quite believe what has happened.

title: Emma Raducanu says split from coach Torben Beltz was a 'tough' decision
description: British tennis star Emma Raducanu says it was a "tough" decision to split with coach Torben Beltz after only five months together.

title: Liverpool takes control of Champions League semifinal after dominant victory against Villarreal
description: Liverpool produced an impressive performance to beat Villarreal 2-0 in its Champions League semifinal first leg on Wednesday.

title: Afghan women footballers who fled Taliban want to be a voice for the voiceless
description: Even though she says the images play out like a movie in her mind, it's a scene she couldn't possibly ever have imagined: The end of her world as she knew it, and quite possibly her own imminent demise.

title: Crucial tropical forests were destroyed at a rate of 10 soccer fields a minute last year
description: The area of tropical forest destroyed in 2021 was enough to cover the entire island of Cuba, and sent more carbon dioxide into the atmosphere as India does in an entire year from burning fossil fuels, according to an analysis published Thursday.

title: China imposes lockdowns on 27 cities, affecting up to 165 million people
description: China has introduced lockdown measures in its two biggest cities, Beijing and Shanghai -- the twin engines that power much of the nation's economy -- in an uncompromising bid to stamp out Covid-19 outbreaks.

title: Family of victim in 'Rust' shooting demands Santa Fe County Sheriff's Office remove graphic video of her dying after being fatally injured, attorney letter says
description: The family of Halyna Hutchins is demanding the Santa Fe County Sheriff's Office remove video it released of her "dying on the church floor" in the moments after she was shot on the set of the movie "Rust" last year, according to a letter written by the family's attorney and obtained by CNN.

title: Russian forces step up attacks on steel plant in Mariupol
description: The Azovstal iron and steel plant went from driving Mariupol's economy and community to becoming its last line of defense. Now, this wall of steel is shielding Ukrainian soldiers and civilians from Russia's onslaught. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

title: India's latest box office smash 'The Kashmir Files' exposes deepening religious divides
description: "If you don't leave from here, we will burn your houses," a bearded Muslim man in a traditional skullcap cries as he rallies against Kashmir's minority Hindus.

title: Eleven in Indian religious procession die after freak electrocution
description: A freak electrocution in southern India killed at least 11 people, including two children, when their vehicle snagged overhead transmission lines and burst into flames as they rode in a religious procession, authorities said on Wednesday.

title: Shanghai resident describes what it's like inside Covid-19 quarantine facility
description: Shanghai resident Jane Polubotko describes what it was like to be held inside a government-run Covid-19 quarantine facility.
